item.title: C# need help passing a list as a parameter
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

You might wanna call your Object class something else, that name is more or less reserved for the language itself.

item.source: C# need help passing a list as a parameter

item.title: C# need help passing a list as a parameter
item.dc:creator: @Kattoor Snow_
item.description:
@Kattoor wrote:

Ok, so…
What I’m trying to do:
Create a list called lObjects of a class called ‘Object’
Create a list called lSlides of a class called ‘Slide’

class Object { public string oclass { get; set; } public string oname { get; set; } public string otext { get; set; } public string osrc { get; set; } public Point opoint { get; set; } public Size osize { get; set; } }

class Slide { public string sname { get; set; } public List<Object> sobjects { get; set; } }

public List<Object> lObjects = new List<Object>(); public List<Slide> lSlides = new List<Slide>();

Now…
In the above code, everything works well

^ makes a messagebox popup with the text “2” (the amount of objects on that slide)

But…

getSlides slides = new getSlides(); slides.getAllSlides("test.txt"); //the slide and object data is located in that file int sC = slides.lslides.Count(); int oC = slides.lslides[0].sobjects.Count(); string sName = slides.lslides[1].sname;
sC is correct (the total amount of slides)
sName is correct (the name of the second slide)
oC is incorrect, the value is 0? As you can see, in the code at the top of my post the messagebox says this value is 2?

I’d really appreciate it if anyone could help me with this…
If I have to provide any more info, you can tell me so!

Read full topic
item.source: C# need help passing a list as a parameter
